titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Penn Museum 89-13-334 89-13-334: Illuminated Thai manuscript fragment

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (viewed on July 15, 2015).
Khoi paper with text in black; originally folded concertina- or accordion-style, but now the illuminated folio is housed open and flat.
Manuscript illustrated with images of Rama and Sita.
Probably written and illustrated in the 1820s or 1830s, based on the use of only four colors (Justin McDaniel).
Dimensions of original manuscript: 12.2 x 62.5 cm (folded), 25.5 x 62.5 cm (unfolded).
Tape or paper glued to hinge and edges on verso.

Reproduced from the original with permission of the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0) license.

msIdentifier.repository: University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology

msContents.summary: Manuscript fragment with one illuminated folio, with two halves of text folios on the verso.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rama and Sita?, f. A01 left
Rama embracing Sita, f. A01 right

history.provenance: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989.

keywords.term: Illumination of books and manuscripts, Thai--Specimens
